intro: Vernonia melleri var. superba, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Hawaii. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, purple to violet flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested or coastal areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and its role in supporting local pollinators.
